tutorial.txt.content:
Welcome to env0.terminal!

You are in a simulated terminal. Try these commands:

- ls                  : List files/directories in the current folder
- cd [dir]            : Change directory (cd .. to go up, cd / for root)
- cat [file]          : View a fileâ€™s contents
- read [file]         : Paginated view for long files
- help                : List all available commands
- ssh [host]          : Connect to another device (if you know one)
- exit                : Exit SSH (or quit if at base terminal)

Other tips:
- Tab/arrow keys for history and editing (if supported by your UI)
- Files with strange or corrupted contents are intentional.
- Explore, poke around, and try breaking things!

If youâ€™re lost, cd /home/user, read the notes, and explore /secrets for hidden content. Good luck!

notes.txt.content:
Welcome home!
- Try cd /secrets
- There are odd logs in /log
- If you find any .bin files, open at your own risk.
- To reboot: try not to. The last person who did isnâ€™t here anymore.

User Manual (Partial)

For advanced users only. Most pages are missing.

howto-ssh.txt.content:
To connect to another machine:
1. Get the hostname (see 'nmap')
2. ssh [hostname]
3. Enter username and password

Remember: some devices are best left alone.

joke.txt.content: Why do ghosts love terminals? Because they can haunt every session.
